alternatives.transcript: Hi lovelies. Welcome back to my kitchen. And if you are new here, you're most welcome to taste City. In today's video, I'll be showing you how to make the perfect lump free semolina fufu. Let's get started. To get started, I'll begin by measuring out one cup of semolina into a bowl, which I'll be using to make a slurry, and this will serve as the base of our semolina fufu. This method guarantees a lump free outcome. Next to that, I'll be adding one cup of water. At this stage, I'll mix this well to combine then set aside for use later. Next, in a separate bowl, I'll measure out two cups of semolina. So in here, I've got four cups of water which I'm going to allow to come to a boil and then we'll go ahead and pour in the slurry we prepared earlier. So for three cups of semolina, I'm using five cups of water but bear in mind mind that every semolina absorbs differently depending on the type you're using. At this stage our water have come to a boil, I'm going to go ahead and take out just a bit of the water and set it aside for use later and then pour in the slurry. So now goes in our slurry, and at this stage, be sure to keep your heat temperature at medium. Once that is in, I'll go ahead and give it a good good stir till everything is well combined, then I'll cover and allow to cook on a medium heat for about five or seven minutes thereabout. Alright, lovely. So this is five minute later, and the base of our semolina is bubbling nicely. I'm going to go ahead and just give it a quick stir, and then I'll begin to add the rest of the semolina bit by bit. So once I have some of the semolina in there, I'll go ahead and stir, and I'll keep on adding bit by bit until a dough is formed. So earlier we had the base of our semolina cooking on a medium heat, but at this stage we have to stir on a high heat. So please make sure you are stirring on a high heat at this point. So I have everything in here now, and this is exactly the texture I like my semolina to be. I don't like my too hard or too soft. So if you like yours to be, a bit soft then add less semolina because the more semolina you add in the more tougher it will become. And if you like yours a bit more hard then add more semolina. So at this stage, I'm just going to go ahead and scrape my pot and my wooden spoon a bit. So the next stage will be adding back some of that hot water we took out earlier because our semolina is not done yet. So here I'm just trying to break down those semolina a bit so that the water can penetrate, the bottom of the pots. So I'm going to cover this up now and allow to cook on a low heat for about three to five minutes. Be sure to keep your heat temperature on a low heat to prevent the pot from burning. Yes, so at this stage our semolina fufu is ready. We're going to go ahead and mix this well again to form a dough and we will be ready to enjoy. So there you have it beautiful family, our semolina fufu recipe, and you can pair the semolina with any soup of your choice. I hope you all enjoyed watching today's video. If you did, please be sure to click the like button and subscribe if you are not yet already. And I will see you in my next video. Bye for now.

sentences.text: Hi lovelies.
Welcome back to my kitchen.
And if you are new here, you're most welcome to taste City.
In today's video, I'll be showing you how to make the perfect lump free semolina fufu.
Let's get started.
To get started, I'll begin by measuring out one cup of semolina into a bowl, which I'll be using to make a slurry, and this will serve as the base of our semolina fufu.
This method guarantees a lump free outcome.
Next to that, I'll be adding one cup of water.
At this stage, I'll mix this well to combine then set aside for use later.
Next, in a separate bowl, I'll measure out two cups of semolina.
So in here, I've got four cups of water which I'm going to allow to come to a boil and then we'll go ahead and pour in the slurry we prepared earlier.
So for three cups of semolina, I'm using five cups of water but bear in mind mind that every semolina absorbs differently depending on the type you're using.
At this stage our water have come to a boil, I'm going to go ahead and take out just a bit of the water and set it aside for use later and then pour in the slurry.
So now goes in our slurry, and at this stage, be sure to keep your heat temperature at medium.
Once that is in, I'll go ahead and give it a good good stir till everything is well combined, then I'll cover and allow to cook on a medium heat for about five or seven minutes thereabout.
Alright, lovely.
So this is five minute later, and the base of our semolina is bubbling nicely.
I'm going to go ahead and just give it a quick stir, and then I'll begin to add the rest of the semolina bit by bit.
So once I have some of the semolina in there, I'll go ahead and stir, and I'll keep on adding bit by bit until a dough is formed.
So earlier we had the base of our semolina cooking on a medium heat, but at this stage we have to stir on a high heat.
So please make sure you are stirring on a high heat at this point.
So I have everything in here now, and this is exactly the texture I like my semolina to be.
I don't like my too hard or too soft.
So if you like yours to be, a bit soft then add less semolina because the more semolina you add in the more tougher it will become.
And if you like yours a bit more hard then add more semolina.
So at this stage, I'm just going to go ahead and scrape my pot and my wooden spoon a bit.
So the next stage will be adding back some of that hot water we took out earlier because our semolina is not done yet.
So here I'm just trying to break down those semolina a bit so that the water can penetrate, the bottom of the pots.
So I'm going to cover this up now and allow to cook on a low heat for about three to five minutes.
Be sure to keep your heat temperature on a low heat to prevent the pot from burning.
Yes, so at this stage our semolina fufu is ready.
We're going to go ahead and mix this well again to form a dough and we will be ready to enjoy.
So there you have it beautiful family, our semolina fufu recipe, and you can pair the semolina with any soup of your choice.
I hope you all enjoyed watching today's video.
If you did, please be sure to click the like button and subscribe if you are not yet already.
And I will see you in my next video.
Bye for now.
